VII.ii.1.B.4.c
.
Early Termination of School Attendance
If a child stops attending school from a date earlier than the beneficiary originally reported, discontinue or reduce the award effective the first day of the month following the month in which school attendance ended.
Exception
:  If an award is running that pays additional compensation for a school child during a regularly scheduled vacation period (based on an expectation the child will return to school at the end of that period), but the child does
not
return to school, discontinue or reduce the award effective the
earlier
of the following dates:
the date in the LAST PAID DATE field on the AWARD INFORMATION tab in Share, or
first day of the month school was scheduled to resume.
Notes
:
Provide a notice of proposed adverse action prior to discontinuing or reducing an award if information is received from someone other than the payee.
Beneficiaries should use
VA Form 21-674b, School Attendance Report
, to report early termination of school attendance.  However, they may also notify VA by telephone or e-mail.
Handle information received by telephone as shown in
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 2.D.1.f
.
References
:  For more information on the
policies expressed in this block, see
38 CFR 3.667
, and
specific requirements for notices of proposed adverse action, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.A
.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section B - Awards and Adjustments Based Upon School Attendance
